answers.answer:
Home consultations and unassisted patient transport services include transport from the hospital for patients with severe cognitive disorders, transport of immobile patients to the hospital for hospitalization, and round-trip transport for bedridden patients to specialist offices or laboratories for consultations and investigations.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and look under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation."
answers.bResponse:
Home consultations and unassisted patient transport services include transport from the hospital for patients with severe cognitive disorders, transport of immobile patients to the hospital for hospitalization, and round-trip transport for bedridden patients to specialist offices or laboratories for consultations and investigations.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and look under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations

answers.answer:
Patients with severe cognitive disorders, including dementia of different etiologies, autistic spectrum disorders, or severe or profound mental retardation, qualify for transport services when leaving a hospital.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation".
answers.bResponse:
Patients with severe cognitive disorders, including dementia of different etiologies, autistic spectrum disorders, or severe or profound mental retardation, qualify for transport services when leaving a hospital.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations

answers.answer:
Yes, transport options are available for immobile patients with tetraparesis or motor insufficiency of the lower limb needing hospitalization for recovery in health units, based on a hospitalization note.

You can find this detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, transport options are available for immobile patients with tetraparesis or motor insufficiency of the lower limb needing hospitalization for recovery in health units, based on a hospitalization note.

You can find this detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations

answers.answer:
Yes, bedridden patients can receive round-trip transport to specialist offices for consultations, particularly if they have severe cognitive disorders, hemiparesis, or paraparesis, for the purpose of evaluating, monitoring, and prescribing treatment for chronic conditions.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read under the section "Home consultations and self-medical transportation".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, bedridden patients can receive round-trip transport to specialist offices for consultations, particularly if they have severe cognitive disorders, hemiparesis, or paraparesis, for the purpose of evaluating, monitoring, and prescribing treatment for chronic conditions.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read under the section "Home consultations and self-medical transportation". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations

answers.answer:
Yes, round-trip transport to and from the laboratory for paraclinical investigations is available for bedridden patients, provided the investigations are recommended by family medicine doctors or specialist doctors from outpatient clinics under contract with health insurance companies.

To find more detailed information, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, round-trip transport to and from the laboratory for paraclinical investigations is available for bedridden patients, provided the investigations are recommended by family medicine doctors or specialist doctors from outpatient clinics under contract with health insurance companies.

To find more detailed information, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations

answers.answer:
Private ambulances in contractual relations with health insurance companies provide these services, accessed through the 112 emergency service.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and look under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation."
answers.bResponse:
Private ambulances in contractual relations with health insurance companies provide these services, accessed through the 112 emergency service.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and look under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations

answers.answer:
To request emergency consultations at home or unassisted medical transport, you or a relative should call the 112 emergency service. The dispatcher will analyze the situation and determine the appropriate ambulance to send.

To find more detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and look under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation".
answers.bResponse:

To find more detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and look under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations

answers.answer:
The patient, their relative, or hospital staff (specifically for transport upon leaving the hospital) are authorized to call for emergency medical transport services through the 112 emergency service.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read under the section "Home consultations and self-medical transportation".
answers.bResponse:

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read under the section "Home consultations and self-medical transportation". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations

answers.answer:
The information regarding patient rights for medical transport services is contained in the “Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system” by the National Health Insurance House.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read the content under the section "Home consultations and self-medical transportation". The specific guide is mentioned at the end of this section.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations and read the content under the section "Home consultations and self-medical transportation". The specific guide is mentioned at the end of this section. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations

answers.answer:
Yes, specific guidelines for responsibly using the emergency medical transport service through 112 involve calling only when the patient is in one of the situations described, such as severe cognitive disorders, immobility for hospitalization, or being bedridden for specialist consultations or lab tests. The dispatcher will then analyze the situation to determine the appropriate ambulance.

You can find detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation."
answers.bResponse:
Yes, specific guidelines for responsibly using the emergency medical transport service through 112 involve calling only when the patient is in one of the situations described, such as severe cognitive disorders, immobility for hospitalization, or being bedridden for specialist consultations or lab tests. The dispatcher will then analyze the situation to determine the appropriate ambulance.

You can find detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations under the section titled "Home consultations and self-medical transportation." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/emergency-consultations
